Porsche and itâ€™s not even close!  Porsche has and will always be superior to both Ferrari and Lamborghini.
If I had a choice of all 3 id have the lambo, because its an svj. If i had a choice without money or rarity being a factor id have the ferrari.  The porsche is built better for a race. But the ferrari is incredible. Its front engine, N/A V12, RWD... these things are disadvantages when it comes to certain races. But advantages when it come to the look, sound, and driving experience. The 812 wasnt built to win races, they jave many other ferraris that have more racing pedigree. The fact that it is as competitive as it is with all the disadvantages they have built into that platform is what makes it incredible. And driving that on the back roads, canyon carving, I will bet it will feel the most fun.  A 1/10 sec on the track is all well and good, but untill youre on a track youll never be able to see that difference. The Ferrari is a gt cruiser.... and to me, it looks and sounds the best. Its the ultimate car, and absolutely the one Id want more than almost anything money can buy.

How do you possibly choose between these... You can't.. All are amazing machines, wouldn't you say? Superfast is $350k. SVJ is over $500k. turbo s is $210k. I put down a deposit for 2019 turbo s yesterday and will prob get it by end of next week. I looked at 812, F8, Huracan Evo, GT3 RS in used car markets as well. These were 1-2 years newer. Price 100-200k more expensive than turbo s. Well I chose turbo s because I''ve a porsche owner for years, it's the most reliable car by miles (except the same brand GT3 RS), it's the cheapest to buy and probably maintain, it can be a daily, etc,. Would I buy one of the others in the future? Hell yes. It really depends on what you can afford and what you want from your car I guess. I'm definitely looking to get both Ferrari and Lambo in the future when I can COMFORTABLY afford it. I don't want car broken.

Ferrari
Ok I did some homework and the 992 Turbo S is giving around 570 to 580 HP at the wheel on dynos completely stock. A quick calculation will tell you this is 715 to 725 HP at the crank. This is what the motherfucking Germans do, underrate their cars HP by 10 to 15% so they murder the cars on he same power class and some of the ones above. No wonder is faster than these two heavier cars and can keep up with a 720 S or a 488 pista on the straights. What is even more worrying is that the car can do up to 700 HP at the wheel and even more with just an ECU reflash, and some high performance fuel and an exhaust. That's 850 to 900 hp on the crank with minor changes...

Lambo
1) Downforce has entered this discussion 2)  this is the only YouTube channel that can't make lambos beat porsches 3) the lambo inherently has WHEY more downforce than either of those cars. It's meant to take corners at 200 km/h which the others can't even come close to performing for track roadholding and lateral Gs. 4) from the sound of that Lambo's exhaust, that is clearly on a stock exhaust which is very stifling, not natural for its engine due to limitations by law, and is not allowing its v12 to breathe or perform optimally.  There is also plenty of proof where there are several videos on YouTube of Lambos beating all the best Porsches - 911 Turbos, GT2, GT3  merely by putting a proper capristo exhaust or similar exhaust on the thing to allow it to perform ideally like an F1 car the way it's meant to be unleashed 5) the Porsche is a turbo, the Lambo is a naturally aspirated vehicle. The Porsche cannot beat to any times from that v12 with the proper exhaust, and furthermore cannot come close if the lambo was Turbo'd, even with all that downforce on the Lambo 6) none of the people on this channel know how to use launch control on the lambo, there is several steps. Corsa has to go on, esc goes off, left foot brake, right on gas for 4500 rpm hold, release left foot. 7) That Lambo aventador simply kills either of those two cars even with its single clutch.   Real auto purists know what the real car is here. It's the aventador Naturally Aspirated V12 with it's major downforce.

So, if I had $500K to spend and wanted a daily driver, I'm going with the Porsche (in "nothing to see here, folks" silver), as it's so ubiquitous and understated that no one gives it a second glance, which, for me, is important. People see a Ferarri or a Lamborghini and think, " Damn! That's a badass car..," and remember it, while I would know whilst I drive my 911 that I have massive power and all-wheel-drive safety. The Ferrari has clearly tremendous torque, and is more slippery so after 100 mph murders both. It's not called Superfast for nothing. Has more class than the other two together, possibly the best technology, and its possibly the most fun on the road, by adjustability and just perfect set up and the most advanced and flattering electronic nannies of the three. And lets not forget is a GT with a big boot on the back so that means being the best for long journeys.  Porsche is just a turbo monster, that probably makes 60 hp more than declared stock(just because Germans say they do 640 hp and adjust the engine to 700 as standard procedure) and has the best traction and braking.And like they said, on the real world is the better car, if you want a car to take you from point a to b that is. Or if you often drive your supercar in the city. Or If you don't like waking up the neighboors.  The Lambo is actually the fastest off the lane somehow, has great brakes, but those good looks slow him down after 100 mph(Crazy wing, crazy front spoiler, edges everywhere) and lacks torque(engine is more of a screamer than a puller).However the way it looks and sounds its on another league(and I really like the 812 but is not the same) and as we all know, all those wings add downforce and that ALA system make it  the faster around a track(or at least it is on nurburgring, and by a healthy margin). However is the worst at those things the Porsche does so well.  So I take the Lambo with the 812 a close second. The Porsche is crazy fast, but the way it sounds and looks leaves me cold.

Lamborghini Aventador svj
Interesting how there's a huge amount of money in these cars and absolutely zero skill involved in the comparison. Fully automatic mode. The car shifts, electronic launch control takes care of everything off the line, traction control takes care of any problems or wheel spin down the track.  The driver holds the throttle to the floor with the other foot on the brake. At go, release brake and hold the wheel straight. Notice how they are looking around and talking from beginning to end. Because the drivers are doing just slightly more than nothing. Next will be the launch mode does everything by itself and it releases the brake when the system hears go. Or when the cars have more autonomous capability you just stand outside and watch, cheering your car on..  How about a head to head doing something that actually requires some driver skill. You could  turn off all the electronic aids and at least use the paddle shifters or Like lapping a road race coarse

Just straight pipe the Porsche
loud sounds should be bad because it means excess sound energy is being lost when it could be converted into kinetic energy. More specifically it could be of two cases: First is that the thermodynamic cycle of the engine is at a very low efficiency so a lot of the input heat gets converted to excessive output heat instead of useful work/kinetic energy. This is typically due to the max and min temps of the otto cycle being too close together and the compression ratio being too small as well. Another case is that the gases are expelled out of the cylinders when the internal combustion has not reached termination. This is also why you sometimes see flames coming out of the exhausts of lambos. It's actually a very bad thing meaning the energy of the combustion did not go towards producing work for the piston but instead is used to produce sound waves and flames from the exhausts. A typical solution for this is to simply add a turbo. This is why the fastest cars in the world (Bugattis, Hennesseys, SSC Tuatara, or even koenigseggs, etc etc) aren't actually that loud partially due to a lot of sound energy being absorbed by turbos which in turn gets (indirectly) converted to more useful work

If money was no object, I would have all three cars.  - The Aventador SVJ would be for those dramatic, outrageous looks. - The 812 Superfast would be for revving that pyrotechnic V12 every morning (instead of having breakfast) and then leave it in the garage. - The 992 Turbo S would be for understated,  unassuming daily driving.  But if I'm only allowed one car out of the three, I'll have to take the SVJ. Even though it's the most uncomfortable and the most impractical, it will more than make up for such shortcomings by putting a permanent ear-to-ear grin on my face. That engine. That exhaust. Those looks. Oh yeah, and that sticker price.

Every time.  The Porsches win every video I watch regardless of the channel... Unless it's a lower-spec Porsche versus a higher-spec competitor.  The Lambo will beat a 2WD Carrera, fine.  But nothing touches that 911 Turbo.  It ran a 10.1 in a previous video.  Just, right off the dealer's lot stock running a 10.1 and beating electrics and whatever else.  It used to take thousands of dollars of modification and trick engineering to get a car to 10.1 and now a stock 911 does it.  It's expensive, but also a bargain in comparison.  Porsche is one of the great brands on Earth where you get what you pay for.  Expensive but reliable and consistent.  You're not just paying for a name, the engineering and quality back it up.  I watched a GT2RS on Gumbal race every supercar you can imagine on an airstrip probably in Switzerland or Germany.  It raced all day and never lost.  Bugatti, Pagani, Noble, Lamborghini, AMG, Ferrari, McLaren... It beat every car it raced- even the RUFs!  Porsches are the finest cars in the world. And I drive an AMG.

I feel like this is the wrong comparison. It is  something like 720S vs Pista vs Turbo S. The SVJ and 812 are for a completely different purpose. SVJ is a track car. 812 is a grand tourer. And they focus on the emotion part with big V12s. They are about the feel. They are not about being an emotionless rocketship which you can't even hear. The Porsche is great still, but this isn't the right comparison. Turbo cars will always have more torque and will almost always beat an NA car. 812 and SVJ are special cause V12s are going extinct now. All three cars live to serve different purposes
